website_summaries.verdict: The Canon Pixma MP180 all-in-one printer costs only $10 more than the entry-level MP160 and offers many more features. Skip the MP160 and go for the MP180.
pros: two-line LCD for navigating the menu

customer_reviews.title: No power chord included
customer_reviews.text: I wore out a Canon Pixma MP160, and had to order a new one. I expect things to wear out after years of service. I ordered another MP 160 to replace the old one. When I finished the set up, I was told that the drivers had been unsuccessfully installed, and that I needed to contact the company. I ignored this and went ahead and tried to print a sheet and was successful. My main complaint is that the printer arrived without a power chord. I was lucky in that the power and USB chords from the old printer fitted. Just be aware that while the ad says "power chord included", this may not be the case.
customer_reviews.author: Judith S. Grigg

customer_reviews.title: greeting card are now easy
customer_reviews.text: its great for printing different sizes of paper without a lot of adjustment of setting. I do a lot of cards and it auto set the printing just by sliding the paper guide to the edge. my old printers would not do this. i do a lot of greeting card. love it
customer_reviews.author: rare finds

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous find & price!
customer_reviews.text: Older model but mine died and I found this to replace. YAY!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: randsbens

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIxma MP 160 printer review
customer_reviews.text: The Canon Pixma MP 160 printer is a fairly convenient printer and prints quickly. It lacks the ability to copy documents more than one page at a time, since you must place the item to be copied flat on the document screen prior to copying. However having a flat document screen does make it easier to copy a page from a book or magazine that can't be done easily on some other printers. The color copying is very good, and the colors are clear and seldom need adjusting. I received this printer in used "very good" condition and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Donald F. Van Every

customer_reviews.title: I love my Canon printer!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first printer I have ever owned and it has been terrific. Good clear copies, reasonable speed, light and easy to handle. Makes me smile when I use it. Only catch is the price of the ink catridges. Friends told me Canon ink was cheaper to replace but that's on the more expensive models. However, Canon tech service - I had some problems in setting up - cannot be beaten. Best I ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Ann S.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is just like my old printer. I liked my old printer and didn't want to waste the ink, so I bought a printer just like my old one and it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Item broke after a few months of usage. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: RedsMan

customer_reviews.title: very bad experience
customer_reviews.text: When i received this printer was broken, I sent an e-mail leting the vendor know and he said that was my choice to present a claim to UPS; which i did, after a while i contact UPS customer service and they stated that the sender received the reinbursament for the claim that i present; I sent another e-mail to the vendor requesting my money back and he never answer. don't do bussiness with this person is not honest.
customer_reviews.author: Wilson

customer_reviews.title: ... this printer for about 6 weeks and it works wonderful. Be sure you lay the paper to copy ...
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for about 6 weeks and it works wonderful. Be sure you lay the paper to copy on the glass the correct way. It is just the opposite of the old printer I replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the print quality and the ease of use. I also like that you can close the front and the back when not in use to keep dust from getting into the machine. The Easy Photo Print software is truly easy to use. This is a really good buy for the quality. I definitly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: D. Martin-Morley

customer_reviews.title: low cost, high value printer
customer_reviews.text: Not the best printer, photo printer, copier -- but a great low cost solution if you want all three in a limited space.
customer_reviews.author: W. A. Graham

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer for basic home use (except photographic printing). I'm pleasantly surprised at the overall package and the cost of about $70. It seems like a very high value. Text and graphic printing are quite acceptable. It is a little noisier and slower than our last printer, but then again that one was a business printer. Delivery was quite fast.
customer_reviews.author: Brien Palmer

customer_reviews.title: I MAY HAVE THE LAST ONE IN EXISTENCE!
customer_reviews.text: bECAUSE IT WAS MY SECOND ONE, IT WAS VERY SIMPLE TO GET UP GET UP AND RUNNING. iT WAS A LITTLE UNEXPECTED THAT I HAD TO CHOOSE {COPY ONE} AS THE DEFAULT.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reviewing the Canon printer
customer_reviews.text: It only lasted for 6 months. I ended up buying a new one and they took the Canon to be recycled. I guess I would have to give it 1/2 a star for lasting that long....sorry
customer_reviews.author: Amy King

customer_reviews.title: copier
customer_reviews.text: reliable product - easy to operate and not expensive. Not to much else to say about it. Would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia S Meek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The printer works great!! I have nothing but great comments on all aspects of operations.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Sladek

customer_reviews.title: Fast printer
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the printer for a few weeks and haven't done any big printings yet but when used it's fast with good print quality.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Young

customer_reviews.title: Canon pixma copier/printer
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to find this printer/copier. It was difficult to find it and I'm glad that I did on your website. Thanks for the prompt service!
customer_reviews.author: bluebird

customer_reviews.title: Never a problem.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great all-in-one printer, copier and scanner. Ink is very reasonable. Would recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark-Felix

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad printer
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for over five years and just wanted to say that (contrary to what another reviewer said) you actually CAN use black ink only if the color cartridge is empty. I did it for over a year. You just have to go into the settings and choose black only. And it only cost me about $45 total for both OEM cartridges, with about a 400 pg yield. Not bad when you look at more current models cartridges, that cost the same or more, and only print about 160 pgs. Not the greatest printer in the world (the scanner was pretty bad), but IMO, not the worst either.
customer_reviews.author: lnels

customer_reviews.title: Not That Great
customer_reviews.text: The main problem I have with this printer is that almost everything it prints is "banded" -- there are white, parallel lines every quarter-inch or so running the entire length of a graphic or photo. This seems to occur only in areas of color, not in solid black areas. I've had this printer a few years and not used it very much; still, the color cartridge doesn't seem to last very long. There must be something better out there.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Humbug Jr.

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETE FAILURE when the INK ABSORBER is full.
customer_reviews.text: Eats printer ink very fast. But the worst thing is it finally stops printing when something inside it called the "ink absorber" is full. Then there is NOTHING YOU CAN DO but return the printer for service. You can't even use the printer as a scanner at that point. It won't DO anything.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent print and scanner quality with efficient use of ink.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer used on craigslist and had no problems with setup even using a generic power and usb cable. This puppy prints beautifully on both standard and photo paper and the ink cartridges have lasted me for 100s of sheets. The scan function is really quick (2-3 seconds), just know that you'll have to download the large multifunction driver from CanonUSA's website to scan. Considering features, value and cartidge costs, its the best of 4 printers I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: FreshVet

customer_reviews.title: better than Lexmart
customer_reviews.text: I had a lexmart from walmart and it broke within a year. This cannon was rated high on line on cosumer reviews. I like it for the easy ink cartriges they are more solid and have more ink in them . Also printer seems to use less ink by printing out documents a little lighter (which saves ink). I trust a name like cannon for a printer. And I must say the price was remarkably low.
customer_reviews.author: DAVEO

customer_reviews.title: No complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I really have nothing bad to say about this printer. The scanner works quickly and provides excellent quality. If you have GOOD photo printing paper, the pictures come out great. It prints quickly, and despite the fuss over the ink running out quick, hasn't happened to me yet, and it has said LOW for a while now. I haven't had it start up loudly or take more than a few seconds to do so.
customer_reviews.author: J. M. MAHAFFEY

customer_reviews.title: Google "MP160 Paper Jam"
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for less than a year, using it about 10 pages per week for documents, and about five 4X6 photos per week. Recently started jamming or feeding 3-4 sheets at a time. Normal paper, photo paper, card stock...didn't matter. Ran the on-board roller cleaning procedure multiple times, with no luck. Finally Googled "MP160 Paper Jam" and learned that this unit is notorious for jamming. I recommend that you avoid this printer.
customer_reviews.author: dgloo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of looking around before I bought this printer. I needed the top feed for all the different kinds of printing I do and we were also needing a scanner. The printer is really fast and the scanner works perfectly and easily. I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase. It even fits nicely on my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoover

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: To be able to print very good photos, scan documents easily, and get sharply printed documents from ink jets (in color no less) for under a hundred bucks is amazing to me. My machine operates flawlessly. Con: Ink runs out rather quickly especially in color, so pick your must color docs wisely. Cartridges aren't cheap.
customer_reviews.author: C. O. Dickerson

customer_reviews.title: Good, when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I had this printer for 2 years. When it was working, it was great. I used it mostly for printing text documents and some scanning occasionally. I didn't mind that the ink cartridges didn't last long or that the papers got jammed every now and then; however, I am disappointed that it broke after only 2 years of light usage. The paper feeder stopped working. I contacted Canon only to be told that they don't have an on-site service center for this type of repair. They did offer me a loyal customer discount that I could use toward a future Canon product. Is that adding insult to injury?
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: This printer is alot of hassle
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if other printers are like this but this Canon pixma MP160 guzzles expensive ink like a Saudi Arabian marathon runner guzzles water freaken A!! so I tried using remanufactured ink it worked for awhile then somesort killswitch screwed up my printer so I got Canon ink again it worked then I ran out of ink so I got more Canon ink but I'm getting a errorE Aghhh so frustrating!!
customer_reviews.author: Kper#1

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer sucks and is the worst printer in the world!!!! There's always a problem every time I send a job for it to do...its either the ink is low (which always is and I have to pay $70 to buy one black ink and one color ink cartridge because one cannot be used alone), paper is always jammed and then have to power it on and off at least 5 times for it to accept paper, or it prints half the document, which wastes more ink and more paper!!!! This is crazy and a complete ripoff!!! I regret the day I walked into the store and bought this P.O.S.!!!
customer_reviews.author: Saymat726

customer_reviews.title: Decent printer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine a few years ago on Black Friday. I used it as a copier, scanner, printer and never had a problem with it. It is easy to use and install and can go between computers just fine. It's pretty loud and kind of slow but it does a nice job even on photos with photo paper. It really is a good all in one printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: M. Richter

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA Printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been wonderful since we purchased it. It prints very clearly and quickly. The ink is inexpensive compared to our last which was an Epson printer. Great price too! Thanks for the great product!
customer_reviews.author: Zoltarbuzz

customer_reviews.title: does not print pictures well. other than that, fine
customer_reviews.text: ok so if you are looking for a printer that prints quality photos, dont buy this printer. if you are just looking for a printer that prints great quality documents, buy it. but the photos are hardly crisp and lack detail. i was very disappointed in that respect. but i did buy it during black friday also, and only paid 20. so how can i expect quality photos when paying that price? right? other than that, its a fine printer for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Burt E. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Thoroughly pleased
customer_reviews.text: Bought this printer on Black Friday for $20 from Best Buy. I am very pleased with the quality of printing, ease of use and the all-in-one feature. If you are copying documents, there are distinct buttons for Black/White and Color printing options. Scanner works without a problem as well. Overall, BEST BUY for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Satyaprakash Vedule

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this printer, it scans very well (& easily) is totally compatible (even the scan software) with my mac. Photos come out nicely- 4x6 photo paper can be used. Comes with software for a great craft center which allows you to print birthday cards etc.. Only downside (as with any good printer) you will spend real $ on ink.
customer_reviews.author: C. Escaravage

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than a year
customer_reviews.text: The print and scan quality are good for the price. The ink cartridges won't get you very far, but this didn't really bother me because I don't do that much printing. However, this printer just broke, and I've had it for less than a year. AND I don't even use it that much. Poor quality for a $170 printer.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: It's an overall good printer for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good printer for the money, but if your looking for a printer specifically for printing pictures this would not be a good buy. The pictures come out ok, but my mother-in-law has a printing doc for her kodak easyshare camera and that's way better then this. This printer is easy to setup, easy to use, reasonable price wise, but it's not the best for picture printing.
customer_reviews.author: K. Granger

customer_reviews.title: Picture quality of a scan
customer_reviews.text: I had a picture on my computer that I wanted to print and I could not find it. So I scanned the picture again and printed it.Later I found the picture on the PC so I printed it again. The second picture was much better than the scanned one I had printed before. The first picture (the one on the PC had been on a CD that my daughter had given me).
customer_reviews.author: Gary B. Staley

customer_reviews.title: great printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my old printer and scanner. This machine prints papers smooth and clear, no unexpected ink spit at all.
customer_reviews.author: Ria

customer_reviews.title: Avoid at all costs
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great for about a month, before it started jamming every sheet of paper that was fed into it. This was my first and last Canon printer purchase. I'm going back to HP Printers.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: Can only print 1 page at a time - jams ...
customer_reviews.text: Can only print 1 page at a time - jams on the second page every time. Not an actual jam in the printer, just doesn't pull the next page properly.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Harrington

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied Customer!
customer_reviews.text: I just love my new Canon All-in-One! I have used all it's features and am very happy with all of them. The colors are so vivid and you can barely tell you are printing pictures from a home printer. Excellent printing quality! It is the perfect size and I like the digital read out for the page numbers and the way it animates when it is "thinking" Overall, this is a great product and I got it at a great price [...]
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Cannon PIXMA MP 160
customer_reviews.text: I made my decision to buy this all-in-one printer based on Consumer Reports testing and they were right on. It was inexpensive and does everything I ask of it very well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S

customer_reviews.title: Paper Jam!
customer_reviews.text: Paper Jam! Every time! Print, Paper, Paper Jam! It should just print, only occasionally jamming upon moments of emotional self reflection and technological epiphany! Paper Jam!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Rock

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Printer!
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY thing that this printer does well is print documents. Printing envelopes leaves each and every envelope smudged with ink. Printed photos are as bad as I have ever seen. No more Canon printers for me!
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Great mulit-function printer!
customer_reviews.text: Printer, copier, and scanner all in one. Prints fast too. Although, would have been nice to have fax capability (for a few more dollars).
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Eckenrode

customer_reviews.title: Biniarch is a terrible vendor to deal with!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this printer through Amazon on December 5th and it NEVER made it to me. Biniarch never responded to any of my email requests, but they sure debited my account for the printer promptly. If you see ANYTHING that is listed on Amazon from this vendor...AVOID IT!!!
customer_reviews.author: W. Technologies

customer_reviews.title: paid but never received
customer_reviews.text: i can't review an item i paid for but never received, but i can amazon. i ordered this item almost a month ago and i am still waiting to get it. i think amazon should take a little more responsibility for items sold on its website.
customer_reviews.author: Amy N. Compton

customer_reviews.title: Canon- the right stuff
customer_reviews.text: This little printer was the perfect fit in our limited space. Setup was a breeze and it has worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: so far so good....
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it to print a few documents - it's quick enough, not terribly noisy and installation and set up was easy as pie!
customer_reviews.author: A. Hedgepeth

customer_reviews.title: printer cable
customer_reviews.text: Does anyone know if this printer come with the cable that connects to the computer? it doesn't seem to be included in the box
customer_reviews.author: Angela Kim

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Very well packaged. Easy to set up and learn how to use. Photocopies are good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I say it again; Great Printer and we are very satisfied. Dollar for dollar it is a tremendous value! Sincerely, James R. Glauser.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl R. Glauser

product_meta.title: Canon PIXMA MP160 All-In-One Photo Printer (Gray)
product_meta.description:
This no-compromise Photo All-In-One lets you get more done, right at home. You'll print beautiful, long-lasting photos, along with copies that are truer to your originals' images and text. The unique Z-Lid lets you produce clear, complete scans even of thick originals like personal notebooks. You can even print photos directly from a PictBridge compatible camera or DV camcorder--no computer required!

AMAZON.COM
The Canon PIXMA MP160 All-In-One Photo Printer lets you print, copy and scan photos and documents quickly and easily. Whether working from the home office, helping a child with his/her school project or simply printing out pictures from a family trip, Canon provides solutions that satisfies consumers' preferences in look, feel, design and functionality. 



The PIXMA MP160 All-In-One Photo Printer lets you print, copy and scan photos and documents quickly and easily. View larger. 

This printer makes it easy to print and share digital photos at home. 

With a sleek, slanted design featuring rounded corners and a space-saving low profile, the stylish MP160 livens up any home or small business office. As more and more consumers begin to familiarize themselves with the benefits of a multi-function unit for the home, the demands go beyond just having the best technology. Ease of use and reliability have come to the forefront. The MP160 is designed to be extremely user friendly while delivering optimum results time and time again. Fast, Reliable Home Printing
The MP160 is a system that lets you get more done, right at home. It allows you to print beautiful, long-lasting photos, along with copies that are truer to your originals' images and text. The unique Z-Lid lets you produce clear, complete scans even of thick originals like personal notebooks. You can even print photos directly from a PictBridge compatible camera or DV camcorder -- no computer required! With home-office AIO printers becoming everyday household items and digital photography's popularity increasing by leaps and bounds, Canon has created a new generation of multi-function printers, like the MP160, that further link the photographic world to that of the home office. This multi-function unit harmonizes printing functionality and performance with imaging excellence and a sense of home decor/style, making it a great long term investment.

 This four-color printer, with true-pigmented black and high intensity color inks, is ideal for printing text, web pages and photos. Affordable and cost-efficient, the MP160 offers resolution as high as 4800 by 1200 color dots per inch (dpi) and the ability to copy up to 22 pages per minute (ppm) in monochrome and 17 ppm in color. Borderless photo printing is equally fast: 4 x 6 inch photos print in less than a minute. For added convenience, the MP160 also allows for printing photos without a PC, thanks to the PictBridge port.

 Sharp, Crisp Copying
The MP160 employs advanced copy technology to help give you vivid reproductions of original images and documents. Dual Color Gamut Processing Technology improves color accuracy by independently controlling brightness, hue, and other elements to make sure that there are minimal differences between the original and the copy. In addition, with Text and Image Separation Technology, the system can actually differentiate text from an image, making black text and fine lines darker and sharp. Now when black text appears over an image, the text on the following generations of copies can be virtually as clear as the first. These technologies plus hardware improvements in scanning and printing can help make a copy almost indistinguishable from the original.

 Quick and Easy Scanning
Thanks to the MP160's multiple capabilities, there's no need to purchase a separate scanner that will take up extra space in your office. Instead, you can rely on this compact unit to scan with a high resolution of up to 600 by 1200 dpi (optical) and 19,200 by 19,200 dpi (interpolated). With a 48-bit internal color depth and the capability to deal with documents up to 8.5 x 11.7 inches, the MP160 will give you professional results in minutes.

 ChromaLife100 Technology For Image Permanence
The MP160 uses the Canon ChromaLife100 system, including the FINE print head technology for great photo printing. When using select genuine Canon photo papers and inks, prints can resist fading for up to 100 years when stored in an archival quality photo album. The up to 100-year-lifespan rivals that of many traditional film based photos, long considered by consumers to be the benchmark for image permanence. Prints produced on Canon Photo Paper Pro with ChromaLife100-compatible inks have an up to 10-year gas fastness when exposed to open air. In addition, ChromaLife100 prints, when created using genuine Canon photo paper like Photo Paper Pro or Photo Paper Plus Glossy, have up to 30-year light fastness when displayed under glass.

 FINE Engineering and the Inkjet Nozzle
Launched globally by Canon in 1999, the Canon Full-photolithography Inkjet Nozzle Engineering (FINE) advanced print head technology is one of the keys to the impressive speed and high photo quality in Canon PIXMA photo all-in-one printers. Canon FINE uses a groundbreaking high-performance multi-nozzle print engine that ejects consistent and microscopic ink droplets. The results are high-resolution photos with detail and clarity in less time.

 The MP160 comes with a one-year limited warranty.

 
What's in the Box
Pixma MP160 photo all-in-one, power cord, cartridges (PG-40 black, CL-41 color), easy setup instructions, document kit (setup software and user's guide CD-ROM, registration card, and cross sell sheet).
feature_bullets: Sleek, stylish unit can help improve office efficiency and productivity
offers resolution as high as 4800 by 1200 color dots per inch and copy speeds up to 22 pages per minute in monochrome and 17 ppm in color
Print photos directly from a PictBridge compatible camera or DV camcorder; borderless 4 x 6 photos print in just 52 seconds
All-In-One photo printer lets you print, copy and scan photos and documents

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars76 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
